snippet: The maneuver by the United States Navy is a direct challenge to China’s assertion that the artificial islands it has built in the South China Sea are a part of its territory.

byline.contributor: Jane Perlez contributed reporting from Beijing.

abstract: Pentagon confirms American naval vessel navigated disputed area in South China Sea; maneuver was meant to assert freedom of navigation in waters China controversially claims sovereignty over; United States' action represents general international consensus that waters remain open to flow of essential commerce.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The maneuver by the United States Navy is a direct challenge to China’s assertion that the artificial islands it has built in the South China Sea are a part of its territory.

headline.print_headline: Challenging Chinese Claims, U.S. Sends Warship to Artificial Island Chain
headline.main: Challenging Chinese Claims, U.S. Sends Warship Near Artificial Island Chain
